predicate.note: Frames file for 'contrast' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and automatic expansion via verbnet.

role.descr: second item in comparison, usually prepositional

example.name: as preposition
example.text: Its loss of $77.7 million, or $1.86 a share, contrasted with net of $68.5 million, or $1.58a share, in the 1988 third quarter.
example.arg: Its loss of $77.7 million, or $1.86 a share,
net of $68.5 million, or $1.58 a share, in the 1988 third quarter

example.name: another prepositional usage
example.text: This contrasts with the year-ago quarter, when the company had net income of $11.7 million, or 45 cents a share, on revenue of $75.7 million.
example.arg: the year-ago quarter, when the company had net income of $11.7 million, or 45 cents a share, on revenue of $75.7 million

example.name: separate figure and ground
example.text: John contrasted his ideas with the professor's argument.
